page.title: 10Bourtie Facilities/Services
page.content: While towns on the outer edges of the parish of Bourtie has contined to row with the advent of new industry in berdeenshire, Boutie itself has remained isolated and loyal to its farming traditions. Most households, if not wholly occupied in farming crops and rearing animals, have some connection with the land, such as organic gardening, smallholding and horse breeding. There are several households with free-range ducks, geese and hens. the community is served by a daily postal delivery, a weekly waste disposal run, and, because most residents have individual septic tanks, gordon district Water Services provides a service to syphon and remove sewage once every two years. If the septic tank overflows in the intervening period a charge is levvied of Â£30.
